newsitem.title: POLAND: Zloty at c.bank-guarded levels, call depos flat.
newsitem.headline: Zloty at c.bank-guarded levels, call depos flat.

text.p: The Polish zloty was perched at the National Bank of Poland's intervention level in early Friday trade but dealers said it was unlikely to willingly go higher and risk central bank action against it.

They said however, the zloty might be pushed above the safe line at 2.5 percent from the trading band centre by a sudden swing of the dollar mark rate, which could spark NBP currency buying if local traders are slow to adjust the zloty rate.
"A zloty rise is unlikely today and unless the dollar/mark rate swings and the zloty does not adjust, the NBP might leave the market alone," said Piotr Czyzewski of ING bank.
At 0900 GMT the zloty was at 2.53/2.50 percent from the trading band centre against 2.53/2.48 percent at the opening.
It was at 3.14/75/85 against the dollar up from 3.1490/10 at opening and 1.8470/80 against the mark from 1.8462/70.
Yesterday the NBP reiterated its committment to keep the zloty below the 2.5 percent level with a symbolic $15 million intervention.

On the money market one-day rates were flat at early morning levels of 22.90/23.10 percent despite the NBP's offer to drain 350 million zlotys in 91-day bills with an O/N value date. -- Jan Strupczewski +48 22 653 9700
